{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3483883,"name":null,"username":"mahtrobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T22:43:26.207Z","cooked":"

My team has been struggling to get our VH-109 radio working over 2.4Ghz. Hopefully we won’t have to worry about that once we get our second radio but one thing has consistently bothered me throughout troubleshooting. The radio has a status light that is supposed to indicate an ethernet link to the RoboRio. It’s not clear to me what the criteria for this turning on are actually supposed to be, but the light has never come on throughout our troubleshooting despite wiring ethernet directly, swapping out cables, and ensuring the team number is set. Should we be worried about this while setting up the two radio system or will it start working once the wireless coms are working?

There are switches underneath a sticker on the back of the radio. One of them is labeled 2.4 Ghz. Turn it on.

Its actually only marked by numbers, its dip-switch #3 which enables the 2.4GHz radio.

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/practicing-at-home

As far as lights - there is a guide to the SYS lite but the other lights are not as well documented yet as far as I’ve been able to find.

mahtrobotics:

but the light has never come on throughout our troubleshooting despite wiring ethernet directly

The RIO link light on the VH-109 is a mirror of the ethernet status light on the RIO port on the VH-109

frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net

LED Status Indications | FIRST FRC Radio

So it should flash indicating activity whenever something is connected to the port labeled RIO.

If you are referring to the RADIO status light on the roboRIO, that light is nonop and will always be off.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Status Light Quick Reference

Many of the components of the FRC ® Control System have indicator lights that can be used to quickly diagnose problems with your robot. This guide shows each of the hardware components and describe...

I stand corrected @BCBlaze

There appears to have been a revision to the silkscreen printing on the radio back that added the description 2.4GHz as you mention.

Radio issues ... Help Electrical
I’m on a rookie team and im having an issue with the new radios after pushing a firmware updata. The system light is just blinking. I just tryed updateing it to this version. [17370609198745678339637053794238] [17370609690215015360126114353627] Any help is appreciated

Earlier versions of the radio purchased from WCP in the summer of 2024 did not have this silkscreen printing near the DIP switches.

To clarify a few things, the 2.4GHz dip-switch is on, and we have tried configuring the VH-109 as a robot radio and as an access point with no success. We are powering the radio directly. I will take a closer look at the ethernet port lights when I get a chance.
